alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Tuscaloosa; Walker (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 23 at 9:33AM CDT until March 25 at 1:34AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Birmingham AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama... Locust Fork At Sayre affecting Tuscaloosa, Walker and Jefferson Counties. .Heavy rainfall over the past 24 hours has led to flooding on the Locust Fork, and a Flood Warning is now in effect. Another statement will be issued by late tonight, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Locust Fork At Sayre. * WHEN...From this evening to early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Flooding of low lying wood lands and agricultural lands along the Locust Fork occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 20.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 27.3 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
